poem:
"Echoes of a Politico-Morning"

Morning's web spins tales of old,
Russia, Ukraine in winter's cold.
Across the globe leaders convene,
In Normandy, midst wars unseen.

Biden, Zelenskiy break bread and talk,
While Kyiv's clock rhythms in its walk.
Qatar's emir greets Ukraine's son,
As Day's weary loom is undone.

In Moscow dusk, in Kyiv it's six,
The world awaits, politics still fix.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Russia-Ukraine war: Joe Biden and Volodymyr Zelenskiy to meet for talks in Normandy – as it happened 4.13pm BST Closing summary It has gone 6pm in Kyiv and in Moscow. We will be closing this blog soon, but you can stay up to date on the Guardian’s Russia and Ukraine coverage here. Here is a recap of today’s latest developments: Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskiy on Wednesday arrived in Qatar for talks with Qatar’s emir, Sheikh". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
